document.title: Hawai ªi Common Core Standards for English Language Arts

BC03079363C84F64AD9371D883681740.description: Use words and phrases acquired through conversations, reading and being read to, and responding to texts.

3005BC3DDF7F4F2AAC2FD9B9782CAC47.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among verbs describing the same general action (e.g., walk, march, strut, prance) by acting out the meanings.

45C25EDA80764602874209D689B536AC.description: Identify real-life connections between words and their use (e.g., note places at school that are colorful).

6312792689494BBC84E93DAFEDA0225C.description: Demonstrate understanding of frequently occurring verbs and adjectives by relating them to their opposites (antonyms).

EAB5ECEE5BD5440996E0A5D564FA211A.description: Sort common objects into categories (e.g., shapes, foods) to gain a sense of the concepts the categories represent.

5AC2D125565141329FE871FC78C2907B.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore word relationships and nuances in word meanings:

825B8DB70EEB41428C492E8ECAEE7B49.description: Use the most frequently occurring inflections and affixes (e.g., -ed, -s, re-, un-, pre-, -ful, -less) as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word.

75E1E09850F24DCEB39FE31BDDFE9B2C.description: Identify new meanings for familiar words and apply them accurately (e.g., knowing duck is a bird and learning the verb to duck).

00643F4A1CCF408B915ABCC2B013AD64.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases based on kindergarten reading and content:

33A54A7937314094A84C7C1B4350E6C7.description: Produce and expand complete sentences in shared language activities.

8C7704C61D1E4F1AAC8E6700143800B9.description: Use the most frequently occurring prepositions (e.g., to, from, in, out, on, off, for, of, by, with).

F4B28344272B483797F39386CCDA09C9.description: Understand and use question words (interrogatives) (e.g., who, what, where, when, why, how).

4AD7ACCBE99947249CE626BA2543E177.description: Form regular plural nouns orally by adding /s/ or /es/ (e.g., dog, dogs; wish, wishes).

F8E29397D3774474BCF250ED7E223EB0.description: Use frequently occurring nouns and verbs.

B93C48B8A8A54A9DAFA37C558942F500.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of English grammar and usage when reading, writing, or speaking:

0EBB709635D24AB0848BEB665120E91E.description: With prompting and support, adapt speech to a variety of contexts, demonstrating understanding of audience, task, and purpose, drawing on a full range of linguistic skills.

93A7AB17FA2D4B229F080D4822E0AA43.description: Describe familiar people, places, things, and events and, with prompting and support, provide additional detail.

6C1DA26C6D5148B58A17971E41FD30E6.description: Ask and answer questions in order to seek help, get information, or clarify something that is not understood.

579344ED85994CF3AD3048DEB97BB768.description: Confirm understanding of a text read aloud or information presented orally or through other media by asking and answering questions about key details and requesting clarification if something is not understood.

967E405F366F49348B82A97184F53A7C.description: Continue a conversation through multiple exchanges.

7DDD207B7030445FB718680E8D0275EF.description: Follow agreed-upon rules for discussions (e.g., listening to others and taking turns speaking about the topics and texts under discussion).

EC291373FAE84EB087B5C9263D74B6E8.description: Participate in collaborative conversations with diverse partners about kindergarten topics and texts with peers and adults in small and larger groups:

21D946DCF1694BE78A6FCBA558C268C3.description: With guidance and support from adults, recall information from experiences or gather information from provided sources to answer a question.

4533F934AC84491DAC5282BD6CE7B045.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects (e.g., explore a number of books by a favorite author and express opinions about them):

4FA457C566F84E3BA37A634ABAAC1B27.description: Research to Build and Present Knowledge

DD567D2CBA2E4C5F85C822DBBDF31E84.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce and publish writing, including in collaboration with peers.

E1C9FE6670F741C88E126F6CAFCCB686.description: With guidance and support from adults, respond to questions and suggestions from peers and add details to strengthen writing as needed.

DAEBCEF58E2D4094964677578D2A2993.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to narrate a single event or several loosely linked events, tell about the events in the order in which they occurred, and provide a reaction to what happened.

F2371DBA2D3F458E8FFFD24902C9BE7F.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose informative/explanatory texts in which they name what they are writing about and supply some information about the topic.

F036058395FB4C27AE27D3E32C910A12.description: Use a combination of drawing, dictating, and writing to compose opinion pieces in which they tell a reader the topic or the name of the book they are writing about and state an opinion about the topic or book.

BBC1BD119C6E408DA47AA21681A492E5.description: Capitalize the first word in a sentence and the pronoun I.

3AE840A835E54C5896052C435525A7DF.description: Demonstrate command of the conventions of English when writing simple sentences:

E92388AACA4F447D99E4515CAB16F184.description: Spell common, grade-appropriate decodable and irregularly-spelled high-frequency words.

1F8CEED1801348A394C105AB33DDEA5D.description: Represent phonemes in simple words, using letter-sound relationships, including phonetic spellings of unknown words.

45B083F524EE47908A3A0A46397851C8.description: Write a letter or letters for consonant and short vowel sounds.

FDC234549A464A63906D62A658C7B83C.description: Know and apply phonics and word analysis skills when encoding words:

3D7035A5D04D4A0FB743C65378BB5317.description: Write left to right using appropriate spacing between words.

C0E6A012583547548D97EC8133BD2D97.description: Write upper- and lowercase manuscript letters using correct letter formation with guidance and support.

2A3374DBF77F44A28940403835667891.description: Demonstrate and apply correct handwriting skills:

98CF78D063DC49C58A834723A16FDC5F.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

177FC3EE38C8485595B4D70F2F4D8431.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

1E8C81951CC440CD8A7E72E9C772431D.description: With prompting and support, compare and contrast the adventures and experiences of characters in familiar stories.

E417561C4BCD4A59A93375F3B19D8717.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between illustrations and the story in which they appear (e.g., what moment in a story an illustration depicts).

DA10622FAA11466592C2525E7367818B.description: Name the author and illustrator of a story and define the role of each in telling the story

0DB556E06F724CE1A233A589A7130011.description: Recognize common types of texts (e.g., storybooks, poems).

61BBC7CD156E4F5194E6E9712E10BAE6.description: With prompting and support, determine the meaning of words and phrases as they are used in a text.

989844FE4CC8474AB40CAF7A10182B07.description: With prompting and support, identify characters and their feelings, settings, major events (plot), problems, and solutions in a story.

A2382B62129E4A89B418E5BECD0FED84.description: With prompting and support, retell familiar stories, including key details.

EE356CEC73ED49E6BEBE6D6930C6AD73.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

F3CD4F5026974271A46ABCAD957E4D46.description: Actively engage in group reading activities with purpose and understanding.

E606E99137A6401E94496124279D26B4.description: Range of Reading and Level of Text Complexity

7C03D3C186644B9EADB264C5554F527B.description: With prompting and support, identify basic similarities in and differences between two texts on the same topic (e.g., in illustrations, descriptions, or procedures).

941239B2C741475B8F06B36C27921C73.description: With prompting and support, identify the reasons an author gives to support points in a text.

FE6910B26C544382BE78E18C05D0B3D7.description: With prompting and support, describe the relationship between visual aids and the text in which they appear (e.g., what person, place, thing, or idea in the text a visual aid depicts).

89491B6A81034BE79CDA7C3EDA5F0A38.description: Name the author and illustrator of a text and define the role of each in presenting the ideas or information in a text.

567D0C701A7848ACB56C3CB59FA1C91B.description: Identify the front cover, back cover, and title page of a book.

A34F025BB916484F99DC360C5AF7F092.description: With prompting and support,determine the meaning of words and phrases in a text relevant to a kindergarten topic or subject area.

6B6E41682ADE48DBB7D759DC10511F16.description: With prompting and support, describe the connection between two individuals, events, ideas, or pieces of information in a text.

47E57146709C45E2BB3536FFB5150103.description: With prompting and support, identify the main/central topic and retell key details of a text.

E095045AB26F43928A76C3964858B52D.description: With prompting and support, ask and answer questions about key details in a text.

B6D7E3AE3EE246528859D2CDC0913613.description: Fluent decoding of taught phonics patterns in connected decodable text

5E6DD8D0E0594203A611E60758B0E1AA.description: Fluent decoding of taught phonics patterns in single words

5326ACAB8BC348C5BAD4C63130C7F114.description: Read common grade-appropriate decodable and irregularly-spelled high-frequency words by sight (e.g., can, the, of, to, you, she, my, is, are, do, does).

F629E3C0744148708CDEA9DE6C4DC418.description: All of the above word types with digraphs sh, ch, and th

2B7E649ED48346F9A13F8943625E3AC2.description: Accurately read regularly spelled one-syllable words in isolation and in text, including:

E5305285C471456588A94B9A1E060DBA.description: Associate the long and short sounds with common spellings (graphemes) for the 5 major vowels (closed and open syllables).

DA852BC552D941A88E6694B8FC95094D.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of one-to-one letter-sound correspondences by producing the primary sound for each consonant, and all 5 vowels.

4367AD0F56244DCFAA6C18D7C4953C00.description: Know and apply grade-level phonics and word analysis skills to read:

B1EFE07044144A15A6620C027D8AB712.description: Distinguish long from short vowel sounds in spoken single-syllable words.

85B0BB2BEE3C48DEB79153FCB6AEE1DB.description: Blend and segment 2- and 3-phoneme words including long and short vowel sounds, diphthongs, and digraphs.

1B2066B97812457984613317DA72DB1C.description: Isolate and pronounce the initial, medial vowel, and final sounds (phonemes) in 3-phoneme (consonant-vowel-consonant, or CVC) words, not including those ending with /l/, /r/, or /x/.

435860B37DA247508E6AF8F6F74EE7AB.description: Blend and segment onsets and rimes of single-syllable spoken words.

825222589D0B4044B1BA82EBEFC5957F.description: Count, pronounce, blend, and segment syllables in multisyllabic words.

EEA25880A56741B99A2FBF7C6C591772.description: Recognize and count individual words in a spoken sentence.

E6C94AD466BE4E209389237B9D999DB2.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes):

14F33506E8654B6FA5355D026C420900.description: Recognize the distinguishing features of a sentence:

62EDD6E1411A45E4990E850C46F0D6E4.description: Recognize and name all upper- and lowercase letters of the alphabet.

53C9A7D431924308A4FD231C259066BC.description: Understand that words are separated by spaces in print.

7B91E7D121A74E19B7045A6A874B51E4.description: Recognize that spoken words are represented in written language by specific sequences of letters.

45944104AD3F407FA758B67EE3D7DC3A.description: Follow words from left to right, top to bottom, and page by page.

CE59FF155FF24E95B12066DB1B5AA937.description: Demonstrate understanding of the organization and basic features of print:
